intro: Pedicularis furfuracea, commonly known as the woolly lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with two lips and five stamens, and bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
